quest_name: Dear <Ranger>! We have received information saying

history.location_text: Dear Ranger! We have received information saying that there is a secret base of the famous Peleng Lyakusha named Borzukhan on the uninhabited planet of Bonnasis in Procyon system. Right now we are planning an operation to find and destroy that base, but we need a sufficiently experienced fighter to accomplish this mission. If you agree, you will have to go to the planet of Bonnasis within 35 days. We already have a camp deployed on the planet, where our agents who will brief you on the mission will meet you. You shouldn't have any problems finding the camp; there's a radio beacon nearby. Your fee for this mission will round up to 65535 cr.
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text:
In the camp you were met by the agent of planet Earth.
- Dear Ranger, I am glad to meet you here at the planet of Bonnasis. My name is Carl. As you have probably been told already, your objective here is to locate and destroy a secret Peleng base, known as Lyakusha Borzukhan. The main thing is to destroy the base. At that you will most likely encounter resistance form Borzuklhan himself. If that is the case, you have the full responsibility of what to do, but it would be better if you mange to take the Peleng alive. If you manage to do that we will pay you an extra 1000 cr as a bonus. If you have any questions ask now and I will try to tell you everything I know myself.
choices: Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
How do I find Borzukhan's base?
How do I destroy the base?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve just received the mission briefing: locate and destroy the secret Peleng base “Lyakusha Borzukhan,” ideally capturing Borzukhan alive for a bonus. Before committing to action, the highest priority is actionable intel—specifically how to actually find the base on Bonnasis. Without a reliable method (landmarks, coordinates, local contacts, reconnaissance clues), rushing out “ready” risks wandering into random encounters, wasting time and resources, or missing the base entirely. The question about destroying it matters too, but first we must be able to locate it; otherwise destruction planning is premature.

ACTION: 3
history.reasoning: We’ve just received the mission briefing: locate and destroy the secret Peleng base “Lyakusha Borzukhan,” ideally capturing Borzukhan alive for a bonus. Without a reliable method (landmarks, coordinates, local contacts, reconnaissance clues), rushing out “ready” risks wandering into random encounters, wasting time and resources, or missing the base entirely. The question about destroying it matters too, but first we must be able to locate it; otherwise destruction planning is premature.

history.location_text:
- This may surely become a difficult task, since the planet is rather large. Although I could still advise you on the locations, where, we think, the base is most likely to be found. The three most possible base locations are, in our opinion, the mountains north of our camp, the forest south-west of the camp, or the underground caves, which you can reach via a grotto in the east, by the coast. 
But, in any event, keep your eyes open and your ears pricked, it is quite likely that we do not know everything, so do not let this information misguide you.
choices: Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
How do I destroy the base?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We now have three likely search areas (north mountains, southwest forest, east coastal grotto leading to caves), but still lack the critical “win condition” details: what counts as destroying the base and what tools/methods are required. Many quests like this hinge on having the right equipment (explosives, sabotage device, access codes, targeting a reactor/antenna) or knowing a specific procedure; if we leave without that knowledge we could reach the base and be unable to finish the mission, or be forced into a costly retreat. Asking why they didn’t locate it themselves is less immediately useful than ensuring we can actually complete the objective once we find it. Therefore, get instructions on destruction before heading out.

ACTION: 3
history.reasoning: We now have three likely search areas (north mountains, southwest forest, east coastal grotto leading to caves), but still lack the critical “win condition” details: what counts as destroying the base and what tools/methods are required. Asking why they didn’t locate it themselves is less immediately useful than ensuring we can actually complete the objective once we find it. Therefore, get instructions on destruction before heading out.

history.location_text: - Of course we are not going to send you there unarmed. You will get a laser gun and several grenades in case you run into armed guards. In addition to that we are going to give you a special explosive device with remote control detonator. You will have to find out what is the base's weakest spot and set the explosives there. But do not forget that the capturing of Lyakusha Borzukhan himself is no less important. As I've already mentioned we'd rather that you take him alive, for which we will pay you a bonus, but if that proves impossible you can kill him. In any event do not let him escape!
choices: How do I find Borzukhan's base?
Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We now have the core operational details needed to succeed: (1) three high-probability search zones for the base, (2) combat kit (laser gun, grenades), and (3) the mission-critical remote explosive device with instructions—identify the weakest structural point and plant it there. We also have clear priority guidance on Borzukhan: capture alive if feasible for a bonus, but the overriding constraint is that he must not escape. Asking again about finding the base is likely to repeat the same three locations, and “why didn’t you locate it yourselves” won’t add actionable advantages. The best move is to proceed while our intel is fresh and we’re properly equipped.

ACTION: 1
history.reasoning: We now have the core operational details needed to succeed: (1) three high-probability search zones for the base, (2) combat kit (laser gun, grenades), and (3) the mission-critical remote explosive device with instructions—identify the weakest structural point and plant it there. We also have clear priority guidance on Borzukhan: capture alive if feasible for a bonus, but the overriding constraint is that he must not escape. Asking again about finding the base is likely to repeat the same three locations, and “why didn’t you locate it yourselves” won’t add actionable advantages. The best move is to proceed while our intel is fresh and we’re properly equipped.

history.location_text:
- Excellent! But before you start off, you must receive your munitions. You are not going to fight Borzukhan empty-handed, are you? So: you will get an explosive charge to destroy the base itself, a laser gun and several grenades. Unfortunately our arms supply is rather limited, since the pilot who navigated the transport that was supposed to deliver the arms here, turned out to be a Peleng hallucinogen addict and ended up colliding with five asteroids at once. I hope you are not hooked on anything like that, are you?
It's a long distance to walk, so we will give you a light flyer. It is pretty small and sufficiently shielded, so the enemy is not likely to detect you, unless you expose yourself. We will show you a picture of Borzukhan, so that you recognise him. That's it. Be careful and attentive, and good luck!
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text: You are sitting in a light flyer and contemplate where you should go.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Circle over the camp and look around
Go to the east, to the sea
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We have three candidate regions (north mountains, southwest forest, east coastal grotto leading to caves), but no solid confirmation which one is correct. Since we’re in a light flyer in perfect condition, the safest and most efficient first move is reconnaissance: circling over the camp to scan for unusual terrain features (cave openings near the coast, suspicious clearings in the forest, patrol routes, artificial structures or heat/smoke signatures). This minimizes the chance of committing to a long flight in the wrong direction and potentially stumbling into an ambush unprepared. Better intel now increases our odds of finding the base quickly and planning the best approach for capturing Borzukhan rather than forcing a fight.

ACTION: 2
history.reasoning: We have three candidate regions (north mountains, southwest forest, east coastal grotto leading to caves), but no solid confirmation which one is correct. history.location_text: You circled around the camp. To the north you saw a high range. To the west and south of the camp there was an endless swamp. In the south-west there was a forest. When you turned east you saw the ocean and the rocky coast. "So where do I go from here?" - you thought to yourself. Suddenly in the south, right in the middle of the swamp you noticed a thin trace of smoke
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Go to the east, to the sea
history.llm_response:
REASONING: Our prior intel listed three likely base regions (north mountains, southwest forest, east coast grotto/caves), but we were explicitly warned the information might be incomplete and to stay alert for other signs. During reconnaissance we found a new, concrete anomaly: a thin trace of smoke rising from the middle of the swamp south of the camp. In an otherwise featureless swamp, smoke strongly suggests an active installation (camp, patrol post, hidden entrance/ventilation, generator exhaust) — exactly the kind of “weak signal” a concealed base would produce. Following this lead is the most logical next step because it’s specific and observable, whereas the three earlier directions are broad searches that could waste time and increase the chance Borzukhan relocates or escapes. We have a flyer (mobility advantage) and are fully healthy, so we can approach cautiously and retreat if it’s a trap.

history.location_text: You followed the smoke and soon beheld a group of creatures gathered around a fire. From this distance you still could not make out who they were or what they were doing.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Fly closer to the fire and throw a grenade into the crowd.
Fly closer to the fire and shoot from the laser gun
Land the flyer by the fire
Land carefully not far from the fire
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve found an unexpected but very promising lead: smoke in the middle of the swamp, and now a group gathered around a fire. At this range we still can’t identify them or what they’re doing, so opening with lethal force (grenade or laser) is a major mistake: it could be neutral locals, it could be someone who can provide information about the base, or it could be a small guard detail where surprise and intelligence-gathering matter more than immediate violence. Also, wasting a grenade (we only have 2) on unknown targets could leave us short when we actually need to breach/escape near the base or prevent Borzukhan from fleeing.

Turning back throws away the best concrete clue we’ve seen so far and risks losing the trail. The optimal play is cautious reconnaissance: land at a safe distance, keep the flyer intact for a quick escape, and approach on foot to identify the creatures and assess numbers/weapons before deciding whether to engage or interrogate.

ACTION: 5

Turning back throws away the best concrete clue we’ve seen so far and risks losing the trail. The optimal play is cautious reconnaissance: land at a safe distance, keep the flyer intact for a quick escape, and approach on foot to identify the creatures and assess numbers/weapons before deciding whether to engage or interrogate.

history.location_text: You carefully landed the flyer not far from the fire, behind a huge rock, where no one could see it. No you could see a group of five very unfriendly looking Pelengs sitting by the fire and discussing something. By their side there lay a Human - motionless. He looks like he's been stunned with a powerful stunner charge.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Throw a grenade into the Pelengs
Shoot the Pelengs from the laser gun
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve unexpectedly stumbled onto five Pelengs with a stunned Human lying beside them. This is almost certainly connected to the mission (patrol, scouts, raiders, or base personnel), and it’s also a potential intelligence jackpot: they could mention Borzukhan, the base location (mountains/forest/coast/swamp), passwords, patrol routes, or even the “weakest spot” we need for the explosive device.  

Attacking immediately with a grenade is risky because the Human is right next to them—blast/shrapnel could kill him, and we only have 2 grenades for the actual base operation. Shooting right away also risks one Peleng escaping to warn the base, making capture of Borzukhan harder and the assault more dangerous. Flying away throws away a strong lead and leaves the stunned Human to his fate.  

We are currently concealed behind a rock with the flyer hidden, so the best tactical move is to listen first, gather actionable intel, and only then decide on a clean takedown (preferably preventing anyone from running).

ACTION: 2

history.location_text: You pricked up your ears and tried to make out what the Pelengs were talking about. By the fragments of their conversation you understood you were in the right: the bunch gathered by the fire was Borzukhan's pirate squad, hailing back from "business" and intending to deliver the prisoner to the base.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Throw a grenade into the pirates
Shoot the pirates from the laser gun
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve confirmed these five Pelengs are Borzukhan’s pirate squad returning from a raid and planning to bring the stunned Human to the base. That means they are our best live lead to the base’s location and potentially to operational details (route, landmarks, passwords, guard rotations, how they get in).  

Attacking now (grenade/laser) has two big downsides: (1) the prisoner is lying right next to them—any explosive or crossfire could easily kill the Human, and (2) if even one pirate escapes, he can warn the base and make capturing Borzukhan alive much harder. Also, we still don’t know exactly where the base is; if we wipe them out without extracting information, we may lose the most direct trail.  

We’re currently hidden and safe, so the strongest play is to keep listening to extract as much concrete navigation intel as possible. Once we have a clear indication of where the base is and how they intend to travel, we can decide whether to ambush them more cleanly or shadow them.

ACTION: 3

Attacking now (grenade/laser) has two big downsides: (1) the prisoner is lying right next to them—any explosive or crossfire could easily kill the Human, and (2) if even one pirate escapes, he can warn the base and make capturing Borzukhan alive much harder. history.location_text: You continued listening to the pirate conversation and heard one of them complain about the habit of their boss Borzukhan spend time all by himself in a small cabin somewhere in the woods to the west. The pirate was sure that this habit was not going to do the boss any good, and you couldn't but agree with him, especially considering the fact that this cretin blurted out a bunch of orientation points, knowing which finding the lyakusha's cabin was a piece of cake!
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Throw a grenade into the pirates
Shoot the pirates from the laser gun
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve just gotten the most valuable thing these pirates can provide: clear orientation points to Borzukhan’s secluded cabin in the western woods. That cabin is a prime opportunity to fulfill the “take him alive” requirement, because it implies the boss is isolated and not surrounded by guards—exactly the scenario where we can capture rather than fight a whole base garrison.

Engaging the five pirates now is all downside:
- A grenade risks killing the stunned Human lying right next to them, and we only have 2 grenades for situations where we may really need area damage/covering a retreat.
- Shooting with the laser gun might work, but against five targets there’s a real risk one escapes and raises the alarm, which could cause Borzukhan to flee or the base to go on lockdown—directly threatening the mission’s success condition (“do not let him escape”).
- We no longer need to extract more information from them, since they already “made finding the cabin a piece of cake.”

Therefore the best strategic play is to disengage now, use the flyer mobility advantage, and move immediately to the cabin to attempt a clean capture of Borzukhan alive.

ACTION: 3

- We no longer need to extract more information from them, since they already “made finding the cabin a piece of cake.”

Therefore the best strategic play is to disengage now, use the flyer mobility advantage, and move immediately to the cabin to attempt a clean capture of Borzukhan alive.

This is our best chance to complete the mission optimally—capture Borzukhan alive—because an isolated cabin suggests minimal guards and less risk of him escaping in the chaos of a full base assault. Going to the mountains or the sea would ignore the freshest, most specific lead we have and wastes time, increasing the odds Borzukhan returns to the main base or goes to ground. Therefore we should head to the forest (southwest) immediately and locate the cabin.

history.location_text: You are circling over the woods. From this height you cannot see anything suspicious. Maybe you should descend?
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Land and look for the lyakusha's cabin
history.llm_response:
REASONING: Our current objective is no longer a vague search for the base: we have specific intel that Borzukhan isolates himself in a cabin in these woods, and that finding it should be straightforward using the orientation points we overheard. Circling higher won’t reveal a small, possibly camouflaged cabin under the canopy, so staying airborne wastes time and increases the chance Borzukhan leaves the cabin and returns to the main base (making capture harder) or relocates entirely (risking mission failure by “letting him escape”). The flyer is in perfect condition, so we can land, keep it concealed, and conduct a careful ground search—this is the only logical step to convert our intel into contact with the target.

history.location_text: Remembering the conversation of the pirates that you'd overheard, you decided to find the cabin, which, they claimed, Lyakusha Borzukhan liked to spend his time in. Since you knew all the main orientation points, the task proved to be quite easy. After several minutes of cautious wandering around the forest you stepped onto a meadow, in the middle of which you indeed saw a wooden cabin with glassed windows. Looks like even these days and even among the pirates there are still folks who like living at one with nature!
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Kick the door in and burst into the house with your gun ready
Walk up to the cabin and knock politely
Sneak up to the cabin and carefully look in the window
Throw a grenade into the window
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve located Borzukhan’s secluded cabin—this is our best chance to capture him alive, which is explicitly preferred and pays a bonus. At this point, information is worth more than aggression: we need to know if he’s alone, armed, where the exits are, whether there are traps, and whether there’s any prisoner inside (we already saw pirates with a stunned Human).  

Kicking the door in risks a sudden firefight and, more importantly, gives Borzukhan an immediate chance to bolt out a back door or window—failing the “do not let him escape” priority. Knocking politely also warns him and gives him time to arm himself or flee. Throwing a grenade is overkill, wastes scarce explosives, and contradicts capturing him alive. Going back to the flyer throws away the initiative.

The optimal move is controlled reconnaissance: sneak up and look through a window to confirm the situation and plan a clean capture.

ACTION: 4
history.reasoning:
We’ve located Borzukhan’s secluded cabin—this is our best chance to capture him alive, which is explicitly preferred and pays a bonus. Going back to the flyer throws away the initiative.

The optimal move is controlled reconnaissance: sneak up and look through a window to confirm the situation and plan a clean capture.

history.location_text: You crawled up to the window and cautiously peeked inside. In the armchair right in the middle of an expensively furnished room sat Lyakusha Borzukhan himself. Apparently he didn't notice you.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Shoot Borzukhan from the laser gun
Carefully move away from the cabin and go back to the flyer
Shoot the stunner through the window
Carefully step away from the window
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We have Borzukhan in the open, apparently alone and unaware—this is the best possible setup to capture him alive and also prevents the “he escapes” failure condition. Shooting him now would immediately throw away the bonus objective (alive capture) and also risks missing or only wounding him, which could trigger an alarm and make him flee through another exit. Going back to the flyer is even worse: it abandons a perfect opportunity and gives him time to leave the cabin and disappear.

The correct tactical step is to quietly disengage from the window without being seen so we can reposition for a controlled entry/ambush (ideally covering exits, then rushing in to subdue him). “Carefully step away from the window” keeps stealth and preserves initiative, likely unlocking the next set of actions to capture him alive.

history.location_text: You went back to the forest cabin.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Walk up to the cabin and knock politely
Kick the door in and burst into the house with your gun ready
Throw a grenade into the window
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We already confirmed Borzukhan is inside the cabin, sitting in an armchair and apparently unaware. This is our best opportunity to fulfill the preferred objective: take him alive, and also ensure he doesn’t escape. 

Option 4 (grenade) is unacceptable because it likely kills him and destroys our chance at the bonus (and might even ruin information we could get from him about the base). Option 2 (knock politely) gives him time to grab a weapon, barricade, or run out a back exit—exactly what we must prevent. Option 1 (go back to the flyer) wastes the element of surprise and risks him leaving before we act.

Option 3 (kick the door in and burst in with the gun ready) is the only choice that preserves initiative and maximizes the chance to immediately control him before he can flee. Even though it’s aggressive, it’s the most consistent path toward a live capture given the limited action set.

history.location_text:
Going left you ran into a row of barred cells. Looks like these were used to keep the pirates' prisoners. A guard slept peacefully nearby. "Right!" - you thought to yourself. - "Looks like even Borzukhan's pirates are quite undisciplined!"
Suddenly the guard moved and mumbled something incoherent. You froze in your steps, but apparently he was still asleep. Still you should keep it quiet so as not to wake him up.
params: You've got a laser gun with one charge
choices: Batter the sleeping guard with the butt of your gun
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve reached the prisoner cells area, which is almost certainly not the “weakest spot” of the base (that’s more likely a power unit, ammo/fuel storage, structural supports, or a central control/communications node). So option 4 (set the explosive and leave) is too risky: if we plant the device in a non-critical section, the blast may not destroy the base and we’d fail the primary mission.

We’re also in a very fragile combat state: wounded, laser gun has only 1 charge, flyer is seriously damaged (so escape isn’t guaranteed if the whole base gets alerted), and grenades are our last reliable combat resource. The sleeping guard is a potential disaster if he wakes and raises the alarm while we’re deep inside with almost no ammo.

So the priority is to neutralize the guard silently and with minimal risk. Killing him could still be quiet, but it may carry a higher chance of noise/complications and isn’t necessary. Knocking him out with the butt of the gun is the stealthiest, most controlled way to prevent an alarm without expending ammo or grenades, after which we can return to the crossing and continue searching for the true weak spot.

Option 2 (concuss) is tempting for stealth, but it’s a close-quarters move that may fail due to randomness, and a fail here is catastrophic. We have 3 laser charges—enough to spend one to guarantee the immediate neutralization of the reactor guard/operator.

Therefore, the safest and most decisive move is to shoot him now, secure the reactor room, then plant the explosive at the reactor and retreat before reinforcements arrive.
